meanings.definition: Duckwalks (verb): to walk like a duck, with feet turned outward
meanings.sent1: The little girl duckwalks around the pond, imitating the ducks.
meanings.sent2: The duckwalks of the ducklings were adorable to watch.
meanings.sent3: During the race, the duckwalks of the participants brought laughter to the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her unique way of duckwalking through life always stood out in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The ballet dancer's graceful duckwalks added a touch of whimsy to the performance.

meanings.definition: Duckwalks (noun): a type of dance move popularized by Chuck Berry, involving a crouched stance and shuffling steps
meanings.sent1: The dance instructor demonstrated the duckwalks to the class, showing the proper technique.
meanings.sent2: At the rock concert, the guitarist amazed the audience with his energetic duckwalks.
meanings.sent3: The wedding reception turned into a fun affair with guests attempting the duckwalks on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, his duckwalks became his signature move, recognized by fans everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The dance crew's synchronized duckwalks left the judges in awe during the competition.
